2: g\";s:0:\"\";s:5:\"child\";a:2:{s:0:\"\";a:5:{s:5:\"title\";a:1:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:\"data\";s:84:\"WPTavern: Atlanta WordPress Coders Guild: A New Meetup for Designers and Pr
8: %2C496\" alt=\"photo credit: FrenchKheldar - cc\" />photo credit: FrenchKheldar –
9:
ef=\"http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/2.0/\">cc\n

The Atlanta metro area will soon be getting a new type of WordPress meetup, targeted towards programm
10: ers and designers. Local organizers Mike Schinkel and Micah
11: Wood announced the Atlanta WordPress Coders Guild on Meetup.com and have alr
12:
eady attracted 55 members who identify themselves as coders.

\n

Due to the group’s unique requirements, it is not affiliated with the WordPress Foundation-spo
13: nsored community meetups. In order to become a member, one must be interested in working
14:
with technologies such as PHP, MySQL, Apache, Javascript, jQuery, Git, Backbone, Vagrant, Gulp, Grunt, SASS, and the WordPress API.

\n

“We are not affiliated
15: with the WordPress Foundation’s Community Meetups initiative because we are not open to WordPress end-users,” Schinkel emphasizes in the meetup’s descr
16: iption. “We are instead a group for serious professionals with a goal of raising the bar for WordPress coder talent in the Southeast and to make it more viable for
17:
the major project funders to choose WordPress instead of closed source solutions.”

\n

Official community meetups have a requirement to have membership open t
18: o “all who wish to join, regardless of ability, skill, financial status or any other criteria.” Since the Atlanta WordPress Coders Guild isn’t open to
19: all skill levels, it is running independently. The organizers plan to host workshops centered around best practices expected by clients who spend $100k+ on projects that
20:
demand a high level of performance and security.

\n

Atlanta’s Fragmented WordPress Community

\n

Schinkel has lived in the Atlanta area for several dec
21: ades and has a great deal of experience <a href=\"http://mikeschinkel.com/blog/25-best-practices-for-meetup-organizers/\" target=\"_blank\">organizing professional meetu
22: ps. He’s an accidental connector who became acquainted with many people in the area and has a unique perspective on the Atlanta tech and WordPress communities.
23:
\n

“We have a really strong tech community backed by education like Georgia Tech and ~10 Fortune 500 companies in the Atlanta area, and tons on technology me
24: etups,” he said. “Lots of Java, .NET, Ruby, Javascript and PHP, and at least 10 large digital agencies with probably up to 1000 agencies if you count the sma
25:
ll ones.”

\n

The startup community is also thriving in the area and Atlanta is experiencing growth across various sectors, including financial, health tech, I
26:
T security, and more. Unfortunately, this has not directly translated into a strong WordPress community.

\n

“The WordPress community, however, is fragmented b
27: ecause of metro Atlanta’s expansive geography, lack of any natural geographic boundaries and no single entity with the clout to really organize a cohesive community,&#82
28:
21; Schinkel explained. The area has 10 different meetups, many of which fail to attract more than a handful of members on a regular basis.

\n

The
29: www.meetup.com/wordpress-atlanta/\" target=\"_blank\">Atlanta WordPress Users Group, organized by Judi Knight, is the most successful with approximately 1600 members
30:
, but Schinkel says those are primarily people willing to travel to a meetup in town. Outer metro Atlanta residents are reluctant to attend.

\n

“Also, from th
31: e perspective of a professional WordPress PHP, MySQL and jQuery coder, those meetups are characterized by really novice end-users,” he said. “Rarely, if ever
32:
, is there any significant WordPress coding talent in attendance, and intermediate to advanced topics are never announced or covered.”

\n

The Need for More W
33:
orkshops Focused on Advanced Topics\n

Schinkel believes that the Atlanta WordPress community needs the opportunity to have more advanced workshops and developer-f
34: ocused meetups. “As far as I can tell the existing successful WordPress meetups all focus on the needs of end-users,” he said. “That’s great, it is wha
35:
t in part has driven the success of WordPress, but it also means that there are no local meetups to help WordPress coders to grow their skills.”

\n

Schinkel u
36:
sed the term “coder” in the meetup name specifically to filter out those he would classify as developers.

\n

Many people think of themselves
37: as ‘WordPress Developers’ when what they do is install WordPress; select, install and configure a theme; select, install and configure plugins; maybe tweak
38: CSS; and add some page templates with a bit if loop and template tag coding. So we think of those people as ‘Site Builders’ and think the term ‘develop
39:
er’ is too broadly adopted to have any communicable distinction in the context of WordPress people.

\n

There are a myriad of meetups in Atlanta f
40: or WordPress end users who want to learn about using themes and plugins, but virtually no meetups for coders who want to expand their skills. This is why the organizers
41:
are spearheading a WordPress coders guild in Atlanta.

\n

“First and foremost we want to see more Atlanta agencies and internal teams in the larger Atlanta org
42: anizations choosing WordPress for their projects,” Schinkel said. “For that to happen there has to be a stronger talent base in Atlanta who are knowledgeable
43:
and experienced in WordPress best practices, at least as far as they relate to agency use of WordPress.”

\n

He anticipates that the group will probably have
44: its first “get to know each other” meetup in January and then st

0: more advanced WordPress professionals often become less motivated to attend meetups that don’t include topics that challenge them and help them become better at t
1: heir work. The Atlanta WordPress Coders Guild aims to solve this problem with an
7: avern: VVV-Dashboard Provides an Interface for Managing Varying Vagrant Vagrants Installations\";s:7:\"attribs\";a:0:{}s:8:\"xml_base\";s:0:\"\";s:17:\"xml_base_explicit

:1:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:\"data\";s:3392:\"

VVV-Dashboard is a new tool that provides an interface
12: for managing your Varying Vagrant Vagrants installations. Inspired by
13: wptavern.com/variable-vvv-a-new-vvv-site-creation-wizard-for-wordpress\" target=\"_blank\">Variable VVV, a script that makes it easy to create and delete sites,
14:
ref=\"https://twitter.com/leogopal\" target=\"_blank\">Leo Gopal made VVV-Dashboard to complement it.

\n

Gopal is a WordPress developer from Cape Town, South Af
15: rica. “I installed my first WordPress site seven years ago while in high school and started creating sites for clients ever since. Only recently, after Matt’
16: s Five for the Future speech, did I decide to come out and offer what I have to everyone, mor
17:
e freely,” he said. VVV-Dashboard is one of his first public contributions.

\n

The tool was designed to work with Variable VVV but can be used without it. 
18: 220;Because VVV is very terminal oriented, it’s easy to forget commands when you need them. For example, you might forget to ‘vagrant up –provision&#82
19: 17; when working with Variable VVV (and other site creators),” Gopal said. VVV-Dashboard adds a quick reference page inside your vvv.dev site for commands and incl
20:
udes a list of all your Vagrant installs.

\n
22:
/>

\n

The title of the page displays how many VVV sites you have installed on your machine. Each site and its admin are linked, along with a
23:
ww.xdebug.org/docs/profiler\" target=\"_blank\">profiler button that offers a quick overview. In order for the profiler to work, you must have Xdebug turned on.

\
24:
n

Many developers end up with a long list of dev sites, and it can be difficult to remember what sites are active and where they are located. The VVV-Dashboard interfa
25:
ce saves you time with a convenient list and might even inspire you to perform a cleanup of sites no longer in use.

\n

In the next few releases, Gopal plans to incl
26: ude more basic site info in the dashboard, such as whether or not WP_Debug is enabled, an indicator for if Xdebug is on/off, the current active theme, etc. Variable VVV
27: recently added a blueprints feature, which allows you to set up different plugins, themes, mu-plugins, options, or constants that will be installed to a new site you cre
28:
ate. Gopal plans to create a few blueprint examples and add them to VVV-Dashboard.

\n

VVV-Dashboard is licensed under the GPL V2. It adds a friendly layer between y
29: ou and your VVV sites to make management more convenient and efficient. Check out the project on <a href=\"https://github.com/leogopal/VVV-Dashboard\" target=\"_blank\">
30: GitHub where you’ll find complete installation instructions. If you have any tips on how to improve the project, make sure to
31:
opal/VVV-Dashboard/issues/new\" target=\"_blank\">leave your feedback for the developer.

40: le=\"https://wordpress.org/plugins/\" href=\"https://wordpress.org/plugins/\">WordPress plugin directory has nearly 35k plugins and discovering new ones that have be
41: en tested and downloaded a few thousand times is difficult. Users can browse the directory for newest, recently updated, most popular, and highest rated plugins. With th
42: e exception of the recently updated category, there
43: ’s no way to discover plugins in the middle of the pack. A new <a title=\"https://managewp.org/plugins/best\" href=\"https://managewp.org/plugins/best\">plugin dis
44: covery tool by ManageWP, attempts to sol

0:
covery tool by ManageWP, attempts to solve the problem.

\n

Algorithm Based

\n
2:
s.png?resize=925%2C663\" alt=\"Best New Plugins\" />Best New Plugins Page\n

The front page of
3: p.org/plugins/best\">ManageWP.org/plugins displays the best new plugins under 100k downloads. The plugins are determined using an algorithm that takes into account p
4:
lugin quality and acceleration of growth. A plugin’s quality is determined using seven metrics:

  • Last Updated
  • WordPress Compatibility
    • \
5:
n
  • Support
  • Rating
  • Plugin Popularity
  • Author Popularity
  • Other plugins from the same author

    • Using a combination of
6: metrics, ManageWP is able to display a constantly evolving list of <a title=\"https://managewp.org/plugins/rising\" href=\"https://managewp.org/plugins/rising\"><em>ris
7: ing stars. Placing emphasis on a plugin’s compatibility with WordPress and when it was last updated might motivate plugin authors to keep these fields upd
8:
ated.

\n

Comparing Plugins

Over the weekend, the security team at Sucuri
18: ware-compromises-100000-wordpress-websites.html\" target=\"_blank\">discovered that more than 100,000 WordPress sites have been hit with the SoakSoak.ru malware camp
19:
aign. This campaign has resulted in more than 11,000 domains being blacklisted by Google.

\n

SoakSoak modifies the wp-includes/template-loader.php file in order to
20: inject Javascript, which contains the malware, into every page on compromised sites. You can check to see if your site is affected by using Sucuri’s free <a href=\
21:
"http://sitecheck.sucuri.net/\" target=\"_blank\">SiteCheck scanner.

\n

After researching the compromised sites, Sucuri found that SoakSoak’s vehicle of a
23: cal security vulnerability that was discovered in the Slider Revolution plugin and made public in September. At that time, Envato identified more than
25:
marketplace that were potentially affected by this particular vulnerability.

\n

The Slider Revolution issue, though silently patched in February, has been acti
26: vely exploited since its disclosure. Many WordPress site administrators have not updated their copies of the Slider Revolution plugin to the patched version, leaving the
27:
ir sites open to compromise. Since the plugin is packaged with many themes sold through Themeforest, site owners are not always aware that they are vulnerable.

\n

A
28: ccording to the report from Sucuri, the SoakSoak attack first scans sites to locate the vulnerable file within the Slider Revolution plugin in order to gain access to th
29: e wp-config.php file. If successful, the intruder then attempts to upload a malicious theme to the site, followed by injecting the <a href=\"http://labs.sucuri.net/db/ma
30: lware/backdoor-phpfilesman02\" target=\"_blank\">Filesman backdoor into the website. The attacker then injects another backdoor in order to modify the swfobject.js f
31:
ile to inject malware that redirects visitors to soaksoak.ru.

\n

This malware attack is particularly difficult to clean up after. If your site has been compromised,
32: you cannot simply remove the infected files. The backdoors will also need to be addressed, as well as the Slider Revolution vulnerabilities. Sucuri advises stopping mal
33: icious attacks through a firewall. If your site or one of your clients’ sites is using the Slider Revolution plugin, it is imperative that you check to see if you
34:
are affected and update your site and plugins immediately.

38: wptavern.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/12/pippin-williamson.jpg?resize=800%2C393\" alt=\"photo credit: inQbation\" class=\"size-full wp-image-35588\" />photo credit: <
40: in Williamson launched Easy Digital Downloads in early 2012, he could not have predicted the succ
41: ess that the open source project is experiencing today. The core plugin is approaching half a million downloads and recently passed 100 <a href=\"https://github.com/easy
42: digitaldownloads/Easy-Digital-Downloads/graphs/contributors\" target=\"_blank\">contributors on GitHub. It provides the foundation for a profitable commercial market
43:
place of more than 190 extensions authored by the EDD community.

\n

The Birth of Easy Digital Downloads

\n

As is the case with many entrepreneurs, Williamson

0: lliamson has a few regrets and encourages developers to think about the future when it comes to plugin architecture. “There is one major architectural change I wou
1:
ld make, and that is the use of custom tables for storing data,” he said.

\n

“We opted out of using custom tables from day one, and that was a mistake.
2: Not properly leveraging custom tables that had the exact database schema that we needed actually made it dramatically more work for us in the long run. We’ve had t
3:
o jump through a lot of hoops to build advanced queries for solid store reporting.”

\n

This mistake has made it difficult to build EDD in a way that will scal
4: e the plugin up to a larger user base on larger websites, as needed. Williamson and contributors continue to find ways to deal with it but it is still costing the team a
5:
great deal more effort.

\n

On the community aspect of the project, he has a few simple tips for open source project leaders who want to attract a decent base of co
6:
ntributors.

  • Be nice.
  • Respond to everyone.
  • Make it publicly known that you want contributions.
  • Do what you can to make it eas
7:
y (hint: asking people to email patches is not making it easy.)\n
  • Be very open to criticism.
    • \n
  • Work hard to build an awesome product, as that alone will
8:
attract a certain number of interested in contributors.\n\n

Holding to these principles has made Easy Digital Downloads a resounding success, as well as an i
9: nspirational example for WordPress plugin developers. Williamson hopes to expand operations to include a hosted version of the plugin, but doesn’t yet have a roadm
10:
ap for how that will play out.

\n

“I would like to see a hosted version be available within the next year or two. We haven’t officially decided if we wi
11: ll offer one or if we will seek partnering with an agency or other group, but I’d love to see it come about,” he said. If he’s able to launch a hosted
12:
version, Williamson will have the opportunity to tap into a whole new demographic of customers, many of whom are likely not developers.

\n

“I’ve never r
13: un a hosted service before so it will be a whole new experience for me with a whole new set of challenges,” he said. Williamson counts the strong EDD community as
14:
one of his assets in pursuing this new venture:

\n

One advantage that I feel we will have, however, is the rapid development pace that having a strong c
15: ommunity of contributors affords us. As we iterate quickly on the self-hosted version, those same changes will be able to be applied to a hosted version. It will also be
16: able to go in reverse: as we test out new features in a hosted version, we can apply those same changes upstream to the self-hosted version. Much like WordPress.org and
17:
WordPress.com.

\n

With a large number of people building extensions for the project, and a regular stream of contributions and bug fixes, Williamson a
18: nd EDD are uniquely prepared to support a hosted version. The success of Easy Digital Downloads demon
19: strates the value of building a strong community around your open source project. With the right cultivation and a healthy community, any quality project can become more

If you’re brand new to bbPress, you may not
8: know about some of the ways it can be extended beyond being a simple forum. Additional functionality can be added with plugins, its output can be manipulated through CSS
9: , and development is easy to keep up with. Even though bbPress has a <a title=\"https://codex.bbpress.org/getting-started-with-bbpress/\" href=\"https://codex.bbpress.or
10: g/getting-started-with-bbpress/\">getting started guide available, I came up with my own mini guide. Here are some tips to get you started on building a bbPress foru
11:
m.

\n

Where to Find Plugins

\n

bbPress is a plugin that was designed to be extended by other plugins. Once installed and configured, simply browse the plugin
12: directory from the backend of WordPress and search for bbPress. There are at least 314 plugins that show up in the search results, not including the ones hosted on Gith
14: "http://i0.wp.com/wptavern.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/12/bbPressPlugins.png?resize=1025%2C526\" alt=\"bbPress Plugins in The WordPress Plugin Directory\" />bbPress
15:
Plugins in The WordPress Plugin Directory\n

Even though bbPress.org has a section dedic
16: ated to plugins, it’s essentially an alternative to browsing the WordPress plugin directory. Instead of being able to view all of the plugins available, the pa
17:
ges only list bbPress specific plugins.

\n

Similar to WordPress, bbPress
18: .org/feature-plugins-tracking/\">has a list of feature plugins that may one day, be merged into core. The list contains plugins that offer features found in most for
19: um software out of the box, so it’s a good place to start when adding features. Pay close attention to the Last Updated: information as I encounte
20:
red a lot of plugins that haven’t been updated in over 2 years.

\n

Altering The Look and Feel

\n

bbPress comes with built-in theme support where all re
21: quired elements such as front-end editing are included. If a WordPress theme doesn’t have support for the various elements that make up bbPress, you’ll still
22: be able to use it. The built-in support makes it compatible with nearly every WordPress theme. However, I strongly encourage you to use a theme that is bbPress compatib
23:
le as it almost always looks better than the default.

\n
25:
\"Free bbPress Compatible Themes\" />Free bbPress Compatible Themes\n

A
26: /themes/search.php?q=bbPress\">search of the theme directory indicates four pages of free WordPress themes that are explicitly compatible with bbPress. If you’
27: d simply like to override the default markup to give it a custom look, check out <a title=\"https://codex.bbpress.org/theme-compatibility/\" href=\"https://codex.bbpress
28:
.org/theme-compatibility/\">this Codex article.

\n

How to Keep up With Development

\n

While WordPress releases three major versions a year, bbPress avera
29: ges two a year. So far in 2014, there have been no major versions released. Compared to WordPress, bbPress development occurs at a slower pace due to a smaller number of
30: people contributing and spending time on the project. Not only does this make it easy to keep up with changes, it increases the opportunity to influence the project.</p
33: Trac for development where user’s can submit bug
34: reports and patches. If you use Slack, you can join the #bbPress channel where core developers and contri
35:

If you’re brand new to bbPress, you may not
2: know about some of the ways it can be extended beyond being a simple forum. Additional functionality can be added with plugins, its output can be manipulated through CSS
3: , and development is easy to keep up with. Even though bbPress has a <a title=\"https://codex.bbpress.org/getting-started-with-bbpress/\" href=\"https://codex.bbpress.or
4: g/getting-started-with-bbpress/\">getting started guide available, I came up with my own mini guide. Here are some tips to get you started on building a bbPress foru
5:
m.

\n

Where to Find Plugins

\n

bbPress is a plugin that was designed to be extended by other plugins. Once installed and configured, simply browse the plugin
6: directory from the backend of WordPress and search for bbPress. There are at least 314 plugins that show up in the search results, not including the ones hosted on Gith
8: "http://i0.wp.com/wptavern.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/12/bbPressPlugins.png?resize=1025%2C526\" alt=\"bbPress Plugins in The WordPress Plugin Directory\" />bbPress
9:
Plugins in The WordPress Plugin Directory\n

Even though bbPress.org has a section dedic
10: ated to plugins, it’s essentially an alternative to browsing the WordPress plugin directory. Instead of being able to view all of the plugins available, the pa
11:
ges only list bbPress specific plugins.

\n

Similar to WordPress, bbPress
12: .org/feature-plugins-tracking/\">has a list of feature plugins that may one day, be merged into core. The list contains plugins that offer features found in most for
13: um software out of the box, so it’s a good place to start when adding features. Pay close attention to the Last Updated: information as I encounte
14:
red a lot of plugins that haven’t been updated in over 2 years.

\n

Altering The Look and Feel

\n

bbPress comes with built-in theme support where all re
15: quired elements such as front-end editing are included. If a WordPress theme doesn’t have support for the various elements that make up bbPress, you’ll still
16: be able to use it. The built-in support makes it compatible with nearly every WordPress theme. However, I strongly encourage you to use a theme that is bbPress compatib
17:
le as it almost always looks better than the default.

19:
\"Free bbPress Compatible Themes\" />Free bbPress Compatible Themes\n

20: /themes/search.php?q=bbPress\">search of the theme directory indicates four pages of free WordPress themes that are explicitly compatible with bbPress. If you’
21: d simply like to override the default markup to give it a custom look, check out <a title=\"https://codex.bbpress.org/theme-compatibility/\" href=\"https://codex.bbpress
22:
.org/theme-compatibility/\">this Codex article.

\n

How to Keep up With Development

\n

While WordPress releases three major versions a year, bbPress avera
23: ges two a year. So far in 2014, there have been no major versions released. Compared to WordPress, bbPress development occurs at a slower pace due to a smaller number of
24: people contributing and spending time on the project. Not only does this make it easy to keep up with changes, it increases the opportunity to influence the project.</p

6: uilt to be extensible, offering developers a number of filters, hooks, and actions

. Idea Factory features the following:

o hold all new ideas as drafts to be approved before publishing.

After testing Idea Factory, I was impressed with how easy it was to set up and use. Both idea cr

plugins/idea-factory/\" target=\"_blank\">Idea Factory on WordPress.org for a solid, simple way to bring new ideas to light.

10: ref=\"http://wptavern.com/buddypress-2-2-on-track-to-provide-a-basic-member-type-api\" target=\"_blank\">a basic member type API, which will allow developers to crea

te different user types.

12: st types. This is a feature that already exists within the BuddyPress’ blogs component and will be extended to include custom post types that declare support for i
13:
t. Developers will be able to add support for CPTs with one simple line of code:

\n
add_post_type_support(
14:
\'book\', \'buddypress-activity\' );\n

16:
>codex has already been updated to show examples for how you can get more control over the activity attributes when you register the post type.

"wp-stagecoach\" class=\"aligncenter size-full wp-image-35226\" />

\n

WP Stagecoach has been in beta
11: for the past few months and the team behind it is busy planning for an official launch in early 2015. The startup, created by Jonathan Kay, came in second, behind <a hre
12: f=\"http://wpcurve.com/\" title=\"WP Curve\" target=\"_blank\">WP Curve, in the first round of
13:
\" target=\"_blank\">Matt Report’s WordPress Startup Challenge.

\n

The new service aims to create the most convenient way to stage a WordPress site, with
14: 1-click copying from production to staging and 1-click to merge the changes back into the live site. WP Stagecoach offers a plugin that hooks your site up to the service
15:
with an API key. Staging sites are hosted on WP Stagecoach’s servers.

\n

The beta version of the service currently includes the following features:

\n
16:
• Create a staging copy of your live site with one click.
  • Copy changes from your staging site back to your live site.
  • Choose which changes to imp
17:
ort. You can import some or all of your file changes, and/or your database changes.\n
  • Password-protect your staging site.
    • \n
  • Staging site runs on WP Stage
18:
coach’s server – no need to set up hosting for your staging site.\n
  • Revert file changes if importing from your staging site doesn’t go as expected.
    • \n<
19:
li>Staging sites can be accessed via SSL-encryption\n\n

After testing the beta on a simple blog, I found that the build process took several minutes. Once th
20: e site is created, you’ll be given SFTP/FTP login credentials and URL for your staging site. The site that WP Stagecoach creates is instantly public, which has me
21:
worried about duplicate content. If you use the service, you’ll want to log in and install a maintenance plugin to hide the staging site from the public.

\n

I
22: f an import gets interrupted, the plugin can pick up where it left off, which is helpful for larger sites. It also includes an advanced debug mode for tracking down prob
23:
lems.

\n

All of the staging sites are hosted on a standard LAMP stack, and users will not be able to reproduce their exact hosting environment with the service when
24: it launches. For many people, the stack will be similar enough to their host and will cause no issues. However, if you are running on a more customized hosting environm
25:
ent, WP Stagecoach will likely not be suitable for creating your staging site.

\n

WP Stagecoach has plans to make it possible for users to create a staging site on
26: their own servers, but this feature will be further down the road. When the team is able to add this, it will make the product a much more versatile tool for WordPress d
27:
evelopers.

\n

At the moment, the service is very promising and offers a highly convenient way to create a staging site for a simple WordPress site on a standard LAM
28: P stack. Those with a more customized server environment will have to look elsewhere for the time being. If the tool adapts to become more flexible, it will be better po
29:
sitioned to reach a larger audience with a wide range of hosting environments.

\n

WP Stagecoach pricing will be $12/month or $99/year for basic support. The beta is
30: free and the team plans to add a few updates before the official launch. If you want to test the service, sign up on <a href=\"http://wptavern.com/ https://wpstagecoach

Earlier this year, CEO and Envato Co-founder, Collis Ta̵
35: 7;eed, spoke at The Sunrise conference in Sydney, Australia. The Sunrise is a conference where foun
36: ders of Australia’s iconic startups describe the early years of their business. The presentation is 15 minutes in length with 30 minutes dedicated to questions.</p
37:
>\n

There’s a lot of great information in the presentation, especially if you’re running a bootstrapped business. I also admire Ta’eed’s delive
38:
ry as he comes off as a straight shooter. He reminds me of myself when I tried to launch a business several years ago.

\n

Presentation Highlights

\n

Envato b
39: egan as a stock Flash template marketplace called Flash Den. Flash Den was eventually renamed to Active Den due to Adobe owning the trademarks associated with Flash.
40:
\n

Envato started with $30k and is still a bootstrapped company. Ta’eed receives numerous offers every year from venture capitalists looking to invest in Envato.
41:
So far, he has not accepted any outside funding.

\n

AppStorm was the precursor to the Apple App
42:
Store. Before Ta’eed could turn AppStorm into an app marketplace, Apple released the App Store crushing his idea.

\n

At 32:26, Ta’eed is asked how he c
43:
ame up with the name Envato. He bought it from Brandbucket for $1k.

\n

At 38:50,
44: Ta’eed is asked to describe how massive the Envato marketplace is. His response, “We sell something ev

0: ill contact you shortly.” Or perhaps it’s a holiday and you want to update the auto reply to notify people of any delays in response time, i.e. “We wil
1: l be out of the office until January 3, 2015.” This plugin provides an easy way to do that in the WordPress admin, without having to set up an auto-responder in yo
2:
ur email.

\n

Lashbrooke originally created the plugin for his own use, because he was receiving numerous messages from people asking for support for his plugins hos
3: ted on WordPress.org and WooThemes.com. His custom auto reply message is designed to help point people to the appropriate forum, in case they contacted him for support-r
4:
elated questions.

\n

After testing the plugin, I can confirm that it works as advertised. The only tricky part is the last setting on the page, which calls for the
5: label of the field in the contact form that contains the email address to use for the auto reply. You have to correctly identify this label or it won’t send. In my
6:
case the label was ‘Email,’ which is likely to be a common one.

\n
8:
o-reply-email-settings\" class=\"aligncenter size-full wp-image-35108\" />

\n

While an auto reply might seem redundant, since Jetpack already displays a confirm
9: ation of the message sending successfully, that extra note in your visitor’s inbox can be reassuring, especially since it allows them to reply to the email if nece
10:
ssary. You can never underestimate the importance of communication in a customer’s decision-making process.

\n

Mike Johnston of CMS Critic asks, “
28: to Dethrone WordPress?” In the article, Johnston explains why WordPress is on top and why Ghost is on the right path to possibly achieving similar success.
29:

While Ghost is doing well in its own right,

ariproject.org/en/\">Habari as a viable competitor. Five years later, WordPress is bigger than ever and no one seems to remember the Habari project.

I don’t think any one thing will put WordPress in second place. Instead, a combination of factors would likely need to take pla

ce. In no particular order, here are a couple of things that might lead to the project’s demise.

\n
    \n
  1. Project leadership routinely ignores the majority.<
39:

    • \n

40:

  • The community in mass disappears or loses interest in favor of a competing product.

ndation and those close to the project.\n\n

I doubt any of these things will happen and WordPress will continue to be the market leader for at least the next

19: >There are three alternatives that come to mind with regards to related posts, <a title=\"https://wordpress.org/plugins/yet-another-related-posts-plugin/\" href=\"https:
22: Jetpack Related Posts. For several years, I used YARPP on WP Tavern to handle related posts and it performed flawlessly. However, at one point, it gave me performanc
23: e problems because of the resources used on a shared webhosting server. The webhosting provider at the time pointed out that YARPP was taking up too many resources on th
24:
e server. If you have a limited amount of posts or a beefy server, YARPP is a great alternative because it offers a variety of ways to display related posts.

014/12/feedly.jpg?resize=1025%2C443\" alt=\"feedly\" class=\"aligncenter size-full wp-image-34964\" />

\n

When Google Reader was laid to rest on July 1, 2013, m
2: any users flocked to Feedly, one of the most popular alternatives. Even if you don’t use Feedly, it’s li
3: kely that many of your blog’s readers do. Therefore, if you want a true picture of the number of your RSS subscribers, digging into Feedly’s numbers should b
4:
e part of your research.

\n

Find Your Feedly Subscriber Count on Mobile

\n

Feedly’s UI is notorious for being less than intuitive and
5: blog.feedly.com/feedly-tutorial-v1/\" target=\"_blank\">confusing to navigate. If you poke around, you can find a rough number of your subscribers. If you’re u
6:
sing a mobile device, simply search for your blog (even if you’re already subscribed), in the top search bar and it will display a rough count.

\n
8:
2/feedly-mobile.jpg?resize=402%2C500\" alt=\"feedly-mobile\" class=\"aligncenter size-large wp-image-34933\" />

\n

Find Your Feedly Subscriber Count in the Web
9:
App\n

If you’re looking for your subscriber count in the web app, click your site in the left sidebar among your subscriptions and then look for your total
10:
subscribers under the title.

\n
12:
p>\n

That’s not too difficult, but what if you want to know the actual count of your Feedly subscribers? After all, there’s quite a difference between 3,00
13: 1 and 3,999, especially when you are looking at setting goals. Once you pass 2,000, it seems that Feedly resorts to fuzzy rounding to the nearest thousand instead of rep
14:
orting actual figures.

\n

Feedly Insight Plugin for WordPress

\n

WordPress sites can install a plugin called
15: nsight/\" target=\"_blank\">Feedly Insight to get an exact subscriber count. It utilizes the Feedly Cloud
16: API to tap into more exact data about your feed(s). Once you install the plugin, you’ll notice that it adds its own top level menu where you can click on the &
17: #8220;Feedly Insight” submenu item. Scroll down to the search bar and enter your URL. It will return a few interesting stats, including languages and an exact subs
19:
vern.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/12/feedly-insight.jpg?resize=828%2C725\" alt=\"feedly-insight\" class=\"aligncenter size-full wp-image-34953\" />

\n

You can al
20: so search your competitors’ URLs in order to see how well they’re doing at attracting subscribers. After performing your research, you can keep the plugin if
21:
you want to keep track of your Feedly stats via its dashboard widget, or you can uninstall it and check back again later.

\n

Having a full picture of RSS subscribe
22: rs is important for publishers who want to tailor their content to appear better in feed readers. For example, if you find that you have a large number of Feedly subscri
23: bers, you will want to make sure that each post appears with an image. Feedly doesn’t have the ability to fetch your featured image. Instead, it grabs the first im
24: age displayed within your post to show as the thumbnail in its reader. If your post has no images, it will show a blank as the thumbnail, which isn’t ideal. Adding
25:
an image to each post will help you to avoid this.

\n

You can also
26: " target=\"_blank\">claim your own Feedly hashtag using this Google form, which allows you to have more control over what people find when they search for your brand
27:
or your #name.

\n

If you’re a publisher, you cannot ignore Feedly, even if you’re not a fan of the product. Feed readers are still going strong and Fee
28: dly seems to be leading the pack after Google Reader died. If you have never checked to find out how many people are reading your blog through Feedly, you may be surpris
29: ed. To get a rough idea, just log into the app. The Feedly Insight plugin offers a more d
30:
etailed look and an easier way to monitor your stats.
